channel.title: daily on Vinay Hiremath
channel.description: Recent content in daily on Vinay Hiremath

item.title: Freeing
item.description: I find it inevitable that I explore the freedom of my thoughts uninhibited, particularly as this blog is an exercise in voluntary writing.

item.title: The Righteous Mind
item.description: Book review: Social intuitionism, moral foundations theory, and other frameworks to better explain and understand the diversity of moral systems that anyone in a democracy must be able to contend with.

item.title: Rejuvenation
item.description: There’s something rather wonderful about rediscovering a friendship with an old friend or family member that you haven’t talked to in a while.

item.title: Global music
item.description: As part of better understanding what types of music fit my various mental states and moods, I have been trying to find music when reading or writing material that requires a little less cognitive load.

item.title: Prioritizing
item.description: How does one even begin to prioritize and choose between longer-term undertakings spanning several months or more?

item.title: Lockdown
item.description: I finally decided to make the trek out of my apartment today to replenish on groceries after more than a week of quarantining myself, and in the midst of widespread self-quarantining to limit spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Pride
item.description: I was in a conversation some few weeks ago with a friend in which they claimed to feel pride because of the country they were from, in contrast to many other places which handled the issue in question differently.

item.title: Daily
item.description: I started this daily notes sub-blog to have a more frictionless way to post daily thoughts without the commitment of composing a full blog post.
